abstract: Coalition of 14 states and District of Columbia are challenging lawsuit by Texas and 25 other states filed against Pres Obama's executive actions to allow illegal immigrants work permits and deportation protection; are asking federal appeals court to allow Obama's programs to begin; episode underscores disparity among states on issue of immigration and illustrates how daily life of illegal immigrants can differ drastically from state to state.
lead_paragraph: As some states battle President Obama’s executive actions in court, others move to incorporate unauthorized newcomers by offering them licenses and other benefits.

headline.main: States Are Divided by the Lines They Draw on Immigration
headline.print_headline: States Are Divided by the Lines They Draw on Immigration

snippet: As some states battle President Obama’s executive actions in court, others move to incorporate unauthorized newcomers by offering them licenses and other benefits.
